1.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them, You shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.

3.text: You shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.

4.text: Turn you not to idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.

5.text: And if you offer a sacrifice of peace offerings to the LORD, you shall offer it at your own will.

6.text: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

7.text: And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.

8.text: Therefore every one that eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

9.text: And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, neither shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.

10.text: And you shall not glean your vineyard, neither shall you gather every grape of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.

11.text: You shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

12.text: And you shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.

13.text: You shall not defraud your neighbor, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with you all night until the morning.

14.text: You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shall fear your God: I am the LORD.

15.text: You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: you shall not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shall you judge your neighbor.

16.text: You shall not go up and down as a talebearer among your people: neither shall you stand against the blood of your neighbor; I am the LORD.

17.text: You shall not hate your brother in your heart: you shall in any wise rebuke your neighbor, and not suffer sin on him.

18.text: You shall not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the LORD.

19.text: You shall keep my statutes. You shall not let your cattle engender with a diverse kind: you shall not sow your field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woolen come on you.

20.text: And whoever lies carnally with a woman, that is a female slave, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

21.text: And he shall bring his trespass offering to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass offering.

22.text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he has done: and the sin which he has done shall be forgiven him.

23.text: And when you shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then you shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised to you: it shall not be eaten of.

24.text: But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the LORD with.

25.text: And in the fifth year shall you eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield to you the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God.

26.text: You shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall you use enchantment, nor observe times.

27.text: You shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shall you mar the corners of your beard.

28.text: You shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks on you: I am the LORD.

29.text: Do not prostitute your daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to prostitution, and the land become full of wickedness.

30.text: You shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

31.text: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

32.text: You shall rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man, and fear your God: I am the LORD.

33.text: And if a stranger sojourn with you in your land, you shall not vex him.

34.text: But the stranger that dwells with you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

35.text: You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in length, in weight, or in measure.

36.text: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall you have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

37.text: Therefore shall you observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.
